label: Folder 31: Brady Letter
description: Letter to Robert N.S. Whitelaw from Edward P. Brady (June 6, 1949) with comments and suggestions about the Charleston Grows questionnaire.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: South Carolina power Complany  Charleston  P. O.  BOX.   953  Charleston, s. C.  June 6, 1949  Mr. Robert N. S. Whitelaw, director  Carolina Art AssocNation  135 Meeting street  Charleston 5, S.C.  Dear Bob:  The proposed questionnaires seem quite adequate.  I have my own pet peeve about a questionnaires, and that is they  never give you enough space to propery answer the questions they  ask.  You-might think about that ange.  On the questionnaire to be sent to business  groups: why not aow for a more cear distinction between businesses  which areLocaland have their headquarters here, and those which  are part of a mother complany, with headquarters esewhere? Aso,  having conducted some simiar surveys, it would seem advisable to  either ask for production figures either in units or weight, or  in gross saes value,  else some will answer in units, others in  doars, and an over a tota will be impossibe to arrive at.  Other than these minor suggestions I see nothing  to add. Sorry I" miss your meeting Thursday.  Sincerely yours,  Edward P. Brady
